page.title: 07All Saints Church
page.content: Our school is "Church of England Aided" and there is a close link between All Saints church and ourselves. We have a morning assembly each day and the rector attends on Friday. At times like Christmas, Easter and the end of summer term we all walk down the hill to the church for a service and as there are about two hundred of us, the church is almost full. One of the oldest things in the church is part of a Saxon cross which is the stem part of the font. It is a work of art. Some parts of the church date back to the thirteenth century but some of it was rebuilt in the nineteenth century. When the church is full for our service we play musical instruments and it sounds good.
